steps.title: The victory sign became a symbol of unity during World War II.
steps.content: The victory sign became a symbol of unity during World War II. In January 1941, Belgian BBC broadcaster Victor De Lavaleye proposed that the victory sign, made by holding up the index and middle finger, represent victory and unity against the Nazis. This was because the French word for â€œvictoryâ€ (victoire) and the Dutch word for â€œfreedomâ€ (vrijheid) both started with the letter V. [4] X Research source In the 1970s, the victory sign became a general symbol for peace when people used it to protest against the Vietnam War.
